channel.title: Bloomberg Technology
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Uber in Talks With Kalanick to Fund Pony.AI Bid, NYT Says
item.description: Uber Technologies Inc. is in talks with founder Travis Kalanick to help fund his acquisition of the US arm of Chinese self-driving firm Pony AI Inc., the New York Times reported. Shares of both companies jumped in Thursday trading.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: Travis Kalanick Photographer: Zak Bennett/Bloomberg

item.title: Google Nabs Oracle’s Cloud CFO to Lead Cloud Finance
item.description: Alphabet Inc. has plucked its new cloud finance chief from Oracle Corp., deepening a potential rivalry in the industry.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford, Davey Alba

item.title: Micron HBM Sales Surge, Palantir’s Stock Keeps Climbing | Bloomberg Tech 6/26/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Micron’s earnings as its sales surge in its high-bandwidth memory business. Plus, Managing Director of Baird Ted Mortonson discusses opportunities in the defense tech space. Chinese tech giant Xiaomi also says it received more than 200,000 pre-orders for its first electric SUV. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: How Telegram Became a Magnet for Extremists and Crime: QuickTake
item.description: Messaging service Telegram is one of the most downloaded apps worldwide. Its private chat setting has made it a free space for open discussion in countries with authoritarian regimes. But a relatively light-touch approach to content moderation on Telegram is frustrating governments trying to stop criminal activities and the spread of misinformation that can destabilize societies.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Stone, Eleanor Thornber

media:content.media:description: Pavel Durov Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg

item.title: Apple’s App Store Gets Makeover in Move to Avoid EU Fines
item.description: Apple Inc. has offered to overhaul its App Store to appease European Union antitrust watchdogs who issued an ultimatum after doling out a €500 million ($580 million) fine.
item.dc:creator: Samuel Stolton, Josh Sisco

media:content.media:description: The Apple App Store app on a laptop arranged in New York, US, on Tuesday, June 25, 2024. Apple Inc. risks billions of euros of new fines over its App Store rules as European Union antitrust regulators escalated a growing conflict over rules that strike at the heart of the iPhone makers business model. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: S&P Briefly Touches Record on Easing Mideast Risk, Tech Rally
item.description: The S&P 500 Index closed inches from an all-time high on Thursday, capping a stunning recovery that has added almost $10 trillion in value to US stocks that were on the cusp of a bear market just two months ago.
item.dc:creator: Esha Dey

media:content.media:description: The New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Friday, June 13, 2025. A tempered tilt to safety swept global markets after Israeli airstrikes on Iranian nuclear targets, with oil notching the biggest moves as traders stayed on edge for signs of an escalating confrontation.

item.title: AI Is Changing the Craft of Coding, for Better and Worse
item.description: AI tools are streamlining the software development process and changing what it means to be a coder. But first…
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

item.title: Bolt’s Breslow Is Back With a $600 Million Pitch to Investors
item.description: Ryan Breslow, the chief executive officer of one-click checkout company Bolt Financial Inc., is back with a fresh pitch to investors — seeking to raise $600 million, according to people familiar with the matter. Previous attempts by Breslow to raise cash hit roadblocks.
item.dc:creator: Katie Roof, Lizette Chapman

media:content.media:description: DETROIT, MICHIGAN - OCTOBER 04: Ryan Breslow attends the 2022 Forbes 30 Under 30 Summit at Detroit Opera House on October 04, 2022 in Detroit, Michigan. (Photo by Taylor Hill/Getty Images)

item.title: CareerBuilder Says AI, Hiring Slowdown Crippled Monster Merger
item.description: The merger of job recruitment sites CareerBuilder and Monster failed, in part, because of a slowdown in corporate hiring and competition from hiring tools driven by artificial intelligence, the company said in a Thursday bankruptcy court filing.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Randles, Steven Church

media:content.media:description: Job seekers attend a Diversity Career Group job fair in Los Angeles, California, US, on Thursday, April 17, 2025. Applications for US unemployment benefits fell to the lowest level in two months, consistent with a stable labor market. Photographer: Eric Thayer/Bloomberg

item.title: Tech Stock Rally Is Just Beginning, Wedbush's Ives Says
item.description: Dan Ives, Wedbush Securities managing director and global head of tech research, expects tech stocks to perform strongly in the second half of the year. Speaking on "Bloomberg The Close," Ives says AI is creating a "Game of Thrones arms race." He also discusses the outlook for Uber and IBM. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Impossible Foods Aims to Put Plant-Based Burgers on European Menus This Year
item.description: Impossible Foods Inc. hopes to add its plant-based burgers to European menus this year, bringing to a close a six-year quest to enter the world’s biggest market for meat alternatives.
item.dc:creator: Agnieszka de Sousa

media:content.media:description: An Impossible plant-based burger. Source: Impossible Foods Inc.

item.title: UK Fintech Giant Revolut to Acquire BNP’s Cetelem in Argentina
item.description: Revolut Ltd., Europe’s largest digital bank, is acquiring Argentina’s Banco Cetelem, a small local lender owned by BNP Paribas, amid its push into Latin America.
item.dc:creator: Ignacio Olivera Doll, Aisha S Gani

media:content.media:description: London-based fintech Revolut, recently valued at about $45 billion, has some 60 million customers worldwide. Photographer: Betty Laura Zapata/Bloomberg

item.title: UK Mobile Bank Starling Looking to Buy a US Lender in Expansion
item.description: Starling Bank, one of the UK’s largest mobile-only banks, is looking to buy a nationally chartered bank in the US to continue the firm’s expansion in the market, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Paige Smith

media:content.media:description: A photograph arranged as an illustration in Hartley Wintney, west of London on August 19, 2020 shows the Starling Bank banking app on a smart phone.

item.title: Axiom’s Crew Arrives at Space Station Aboard SpaceX Capsule
item.description: Axiom Space Inc.’s crew of astronauts from four nations has reached the International Space Station.
item.dc:creator: Melos Ambaye

media:content.media:description: The Axiom-4 mission, with a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft and Falcon 9 rocket, lifts off from Launch Complex 39A at NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Cape Canaveral, Florida, on June 25. Photographer: Giorgio Viera/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Trump Mobile Drops ‘Made in USA’ Smartphone Claims From Website
item.description: Trump Mobile, the new cellular service venture introduced by the Trump Organization last week, has scrubbed online references that originally promised its first mobile handset, the T1 Phone, would be produced in the US.
item.dc:creator: Chris Welch

media:content.media:description: Eric Trump, from left, Don Hendrickson, Eric Thomas, Patrick O'Brien and Donald Trump Jr., during an announcement for Trump Mobile in New York on June 16.

item.title: Meta in Talks to Buy AI Voice Startup PlayAI in Push for Talent
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. is in advanced talks to acquire PlayAI, a small startup using artificial intelligence to replicate voices, part of the social media company’s push to nab top talent and catch up in the AI race.
item.dc:creator: Margi Murphy, Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: The Meta store in Burlingame, California

item.title: Core Scientific Rallies on Report of CoreWeave Takeover Talks
item.description: Core Scientific Inc. shares surged as much as 32% following a report that CoreWeave Inc. is in discussions to acquire the operator of data centers.
item.dc:creator: Nick Turner

media:content.media:description: CoreWeave Inc. signage in Times Square in New York, US, on Friday, May 9, 2025. After a heavily scaled down initial public offering, CoreWeave Inc. is in discussions to raise about $1.5 billion in debt, according to a person with knowledge of the matter. Photographer: Yuki Iwamura/Bloomberg

item.title: Micron Forecast Draws Tepid Reaction Following 2025 Stock Rally
item.description: Micron Technology Inc., the top-performing chipmaker on Wall Street this year, delivered an outlook that wasn’t quite rosy enough to keep its 2025 rally going.
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

item.title: British Man Charged by US in ‘IntelBroker’ Corporate Hacks
item.description: A 25-year-old British man known as “IntelBroker” was accused by US authorities of conspiring to steal data from dozens of companies and offer it for sale online, while four others were arrested in France for allegedly running the online hacker forum he frequented.
item.dc:creator: Chris Dolmetsch

item.title: Data-Center Limits Will Hurt AI Boom, Alberta First Nations Say
item.description: Indigenous communities in Canada’s Alberta province are pushing back on restrictions they say hinder investment in new data centers needed to power the growth of artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Robert Tuttle

media:content.media:description: Bitmain mining machines at a Canada Computational Unlimited Inc. computation center in Joliette, Quebec, Canada, on Friday, Sept. 10, 2021. CCU.ai, a Bitcoin mining center powered by hydroelectricity, has been conditionally approved for trading on the TSX Venture Exchange in Toronto under the stock symbol SATO.

item.title: Xiaomi Launches $35,000 SUV to Take on Tesla’s Model Y in China
item.description: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi Corp. is looking to shake off scrutiny of tech-enhanced driving systems with a 253,500 yuan ($35,360) sport utility vehicle that takes aim at Tesla Inc.’s popular Model Y.
item.dc:creator: Linda Lew, Jessica Sui

media:content.media:description: A Xiaomi Corp. YU7 electric SUV at one of the company's stores in Shanghai.

item.title: Palantir Short Sellers Bail as Top S&P 500 Stock Keeps Climbing
item.description: Investors betting against Palantir Technologies Inc. are throwing in the towel as the software maker’s shares keep pushing higher, aided by fervent retail traders and heightened geopolitical tensions.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

item.title: Russia Aims to Launch State Messenger to Compete With App Giants
item.description: Russia plans to launch a state-run messaging application that aims to host some government services, giving existing platforms like WhatsApp and Telegram a homegrown competitor in the country.
item.dc:creator: Sofia Sorochinskaia

media:content.media:description: Russian authorities have already blocked Facebook and the X social media platform, while throttling YouTube.

item.title: Short Sellers Upped Worldline Bets Days Before Fraud Reports
item.description: Short sellers raised their wagers against Worldline SA’s bonds and shares in the days leading up to news reports that the French firm allegedly covered up fraud by some of its customers.
item.dc:creator: Neil Callanan, Lisa Pham, Tasos Vossos

media:content.media:description: The Wordline offices in Paris.

item.title: Hg-Backed Software Firm Visma Said to Pick London for IPO
item.description: Hg Capital-backed Visma has provisionally chosen London for a planned initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter, paving the way for a major tech debut that could draw more listings to the subdued UK market.
item.dc:creator: Amy Thomson, Pablo Mayo Cerqueiro

media:content.media:description: Skyscrapers in the Square Mile financial district in the City of London, UK, on Friday, May 31, 2024. UK assets have mostly traded sideways since the announcement of the July 4 election, but that hasn’t stopped market participants from becoming more positive, with the opposition Labour Party far ahead in the polls.

item.title: Salesforce CEO Says 30% of Internal Work Is Being Handled by AI
item.description: Salesforce Inc. Chief Executive Officer Marc Benioff said his company has automated a significant chunk of work with AI, another example of a firm touting labor-replacing potential of the emerging technology.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford, Emily Chang

media:content.media:description: Marc Benioff, chief executive officer of Salesforce Inc., speaks during a press conference at the 2024 Dreamforce conference in San Francisco, California, US, on Tuesday, Sept. 17, 2024. Salesforce is unveiling a pivot in its artificial intelligence strategy this week at its annual Dreamforce conference, now saying that its AI tools can handle tasks without human supervision and changing the way it charges for software.

item.title: Germany’s Humanoid Robots Fail to Show Up for Their Debut
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Verena Sepp and Mark Bergen send a dispatch from a botched robotics demonstration in Munich.
item.dc:creator: Mark Bergen, Verena Sepp

media:content.media:description: David Reger, chief executive officer of Neura Robotics, beside a Neura 4NE1 humanoid robot in October 2024 at the Bloomberg Tech Summit in London.

item.title: Bluestone-Backed Sports Platform Volo Acquires Rival ZogSports
item.description: Volo Sports has reached an agreement to acquire ZogSports, the second-largest recreational league organizing platform after Volo.
item.dc:creator: Michael Hytha

media:content.media:description: Bobby Sharma, founder and managing partner of Bluestone Equity Partners Source: Bluestone Equity Partners

item.title: PayPal-Backed Pine Labs Files India IPO Riding on Fintech Boom
item.description: Digital payments provider Pine Labs Ltd. filed for an initial public offering in India, as the government’s digitization push fuels a boom in the financial technology space.
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Joshi

media:content.media:description: The National Stock Exchange in Mumbai.

item.title: SoftBank Unit Plans First Dollar Bond for $1 Billion
item.description: SoftBank Group Corp.’s telecommunications unit plans to make its first offering of US dollar-denominated bonds, with Morgan Stanley and others acting as lead managers, in a deal that aims to raise about $1 billion.
item.dc:creator: Takahiko Hyuga, Ameya Karve

media:content.media:description: A SoftBank Corp store in Tokyo.
